p: Previous reports found that the mean time of onset-admission interval in deceased patients was 6.2 days [ 18]. Data from 72,314 cases recorded by the Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention indicated an interval of 7 days between onset peak and diagnosis peak [ 19, 20]. Data showing that the median time from onset to admission and diagnosis was 4 days suggested that the identification and treatment of cases, including isolation referrals, as observed in this relatively short time, suggested that prompt management after illness onset helped to blunt onward community transmission. In China, it was recommended that patients with mild disease also receive inpatient isolation and treatment.
